results.title: Pro-haemorrhagic effects of calcium antagonists: a comparison of isradipine and atenolol on ex vivo platelet function in hypertensive subjects.
results.text_hl: Pro-@<m>DISEASE_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006470 @@@haemorrhagic@@@ effects of calcium antagonists: a comparison of @CHEMICAL_Isradipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017275 @@@isradipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on ex vivo platelet function in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ subjects.

citations.NLM: Smith A, McPherson J, Taylor M, Mason A, Carney S, Gillies A. Pro-haemorrhagic effects of calcium antagonists: a comparison of isradipine and atenolol on ex vivo platelet function in hypertensive subjects. J Hum Hypertens. 1997 Dec;11(12):783-8. PMID: 9468004
citations.BibTeX: @article{9468004, title={Pro-haemorrhagic effects of calcium antagonists: a comparison of isradipine and atenolol on ex vivo platelet function in hypertensive subjects.}, author={Smith A and McPherson J and Taylor M and Mason A and Carney S and Gillies A}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={11}, number={12}, pages={783-8}}

results.title: Differential associations of beta-blockers with hemorrhagic events for chronic heart failure patients on warfarin.
results.text_hl: Compared to @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@, the hazards ratio for a new @<m>DISEASE_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006470 @@@hemorrhagic@@@ event was 1.25 (1.17, 1.34) for no beta-blocker, 1.27 (1.18, 1.38) for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and 1.38 (1.28, 1.48) for @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Berlowitz DR, Miller DR, Oliveria SA, Cunningham F, Gomez-Caminero A, Rothendler JA. Differential associations of beta-blockers with hemorrhagic events for chronic heart failure patients on warfarin. Pharmacoepidemiol Drug Saf. 2006 Nov;15(11):799-807. PMID: 16892457
citations.BibTeX: @article{16892457, title={Differential associations of beta-blockers with hemorrhagic events for chronic heart failure patients on warfarin.}, author={Berlowitz DR and Miller DR and Oliveria SA and Cunningham F and Gomez-Caminero A and Rothendler JA}, journal={Pharmacoepidemiol Drug Saf}, volume={15}, number={11}, pages={799-807}}

results.title: Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study.
results.text_hl: The incidence of rebleeding was significantly lower in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ than in those on placebo (PR vs PL: p less than 0.01, log-rank test). @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ was less effective than @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (AT vs PL: p = 0.065, log-rank test) but @<m>DISEASE_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006470 @@@bleeding@@@-free survival was improved for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on active drugs compared with those @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on placebo (PR vs PL: p = 0.01; AT vs PL: p = 0.05, log-rank test).

citations.NLM: Tommasini M, de Franchis R, Sangiovanni A, Colombo M. Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study. Drugs. 1989;37 Suppl 2():35-41; discussion 47. PMID: 2572412
citations.BibTeX: @article{2572412, title={Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study.}, author={Tommasini M and de Franchis R and Sangiovanni A and Colombo M}, journal={Drugs}, volume={37 Suppl 2}, pages={35-41; discussion 47}}
